channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Facing Resistance in Texas, Syrian Refugees Find Temporary Sanctuary in New York
item.description: As Texas sues to block Syrian refugees from resettling inside its borders, Mayor Bill de Blasio said he welcomed a dozen Texas-bound arrivals to New York City "with open arms."
item.dc:creator: LIZ ROBBINS and C. J. HUGHES

item.title: World Briefing: Central African Republic: Attack Kills 8 Civilians at Camp for Displaced People
item.description: United Nations peacekeepers intervened in the attack, which also left five of the assailants dead and several other people wounded.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Mali: Group Merges With Al Qaeda
item.description: The Islamist extremist group Al Mourabitoun is said to be joining Al Qaeda’s North Africa branch.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Georgia: Ex-President Loses Citizenship
item.description: Former President Mikheil Saakashvili was stripped of his citizenship, a move one of his supporters described as a settling of scores.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Venezuela’s Economic Woes Buoy Opposition Before Election
item.description: The mood in neighborhoods that were once strongholds of Hugo Chávez now seems receptive to opposition candidates in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM NEUMAN
item.media:credit: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Nicolás Maduro at a rally on Thursday in Caracas. He paused several times for a response but got only scattered cheers.

item.title: Cuba and U.S. to Discuss Settling Claims on Property
item.description: Negotiators will discuss decades-old property claims from thousands of American citizens and companies whose assets were confiscated after Cuba’s revolution.
item.dc:creator: FRANCES ROBLES

item.title: Justin Trudeau Outlines Sweeping Agenda for Canada
item.description: In an address to Parliament, he promised to push for the legalization of marijuana, middle-class tax cuts and a revamping of how Canadians elect the House of Commons.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN
item.media:description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada, left, and Governor General David Johnston in Parliament in Ottawa on Friday.

item.title: World Briefing: E.U. Agrees to Share Air Passenger Data
item.description: Law enforcement agencies will have access to information gathered by airlines, like names, travel dates, itinerary, credit cards and contact details.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: U.S. Presses for U.N. Resolution to Fight ISIS’ Financing
item.description: A special meeting of the Security Council will try to bolster efforts to cut off revenues that the Islamic State raises in its territory.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: STEVEN LEE MYERS and SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: Footage released Friday by Russia's Defense Ministry showed an airstrike that the ministry said targeted Islamic State trucks transporting oil, which the militant group sells to fund its activities.

item.title: Draghi Says No Limits on European Stimulus Measures
item.description: Markets fell sharply on Thursday, on concern the European Central Bank’s stimulus package was not stronger. On Friday, Mario Draghi said there would be “no particular limit” to the bank’s efforts.
item.dc:creator: LANDON THOMAS Jr.
item.media:description: Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank, told Wall Street investors that he would do all he could to push Europe’s stagnating economy toward a full recovery.

item.title: Gad Elmaleh: Talking Funny in French and English
item.description: The Moroccan-born French comedian often called the Jerry Seinfeld of France is hoping for success here as well.
item.dc:creator: ELISE CZAJKOWSKI
item.media:credit: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times
item.media:description: Gad Elmaleh, a Moroccan-French stand-up comedian, outside Joe's Pub.

item.title: Delhi to Limit Use of Cars in an Effort to Control Pollution
item.description: As of Jan. 1, the authorities will limit the use of private cars in the Indian capital to every other day, depending on whether a vehicle’s license plate ends in an even or odd number.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR

item.title: Marcus Klingberg, Highest-Ranking Soviet Spy Caught in Israel, Dies at 97
item.description: Mr. Klingberg, an Israeli scientist, was a Soviet spy whose activities were regarded as so damaging that he was imprisoned in secret for years under a false identity.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM GRIMES
item.media:description: Marcus Klingberg seen in 1996 in Jerusalem during an appeal for early release. It was rejected.

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi-Led Coalition to Investigate Bombing of Clinic in Yemen
item.description: The clinic, operated by Doctors Without Borders, was hit by airstrikes on Wednesday morning, leaving nine people injured.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Inquiry Into Paris Terror Attacks Widens to Eastern Europe
item.description: The disclosure of a Hungarian connection to the attacks has raised the question of whether jihadist militants have joined a flow of asylum seekers.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: The China Factor | Part 4: China Creates a World Bank of Its Own, and the U.S. Balks
item.description: In setting up the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, China enlisted American allies, including Britain, even as Washington expressed skepticism.
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ
item.media:description: President Xi Jinping of China spoke in Beijing in November 2014 during a visit by President Obama and Secretary of State John Kerry. China, with its vast wealth and resources, now rivals the United States at the global economic table.

item.title: La Bonne Bière, Cafe Hit in Paris Attacks, Is Back in Business
item.description: The cafe drew hundreds who sought to measure their grief about the terrorist rampage on Nov. 13 and raise a glass in a symbolic gesture of defiance.
item.dc:creator: LIZ ALDERMAN
item.media:description: La Bonne Bière reopened on Friday in Paris. "Je suis en terrace" — I'm out on the terrace — has become the new rallying cry of many Parisians since the terrorist attacks of Nov. 13.

item.title: Is Gollum Good or Evil? Jail Term in Turkey Hinges on Answer
item.description: Experts are weighing whether a comparison of Turkey’s president with the J.R.R. Tolkien character was an insult, which could send a doctor to jail.
item.dc:creator: KATIE ROGERS
item.media:credit: Francois Mori/Associated Press; Warner Brothers Pictures and MGM

item.title: Russian Truckers, Irate Over New Tolls, Block Roads Near Moscow
item.description: The truck drivers unhappy about new tolls and the economy are the kind of bedrock Russians for whom Vladimir V. Putin has long been a hero.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: Despite Climate Concerns, OPEC Plans to Keep Pumping Oil While It Can
item.description: Some members, including the United Arab Emirates, have acknowledged that they need to diversify and wean themselves from an oil-rich diet.
item.category: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
item.dc:creator: STANLEY REED and SARA HAMDAN
item.media:description: An electric car in Masdar City, in the United Arab Emirates. The nation's delegation to the Paris climate conference has pledged to increase the U.A.E.’s use of renewable energy.
